title: The Vanishing Whiteboard Notes
setting: Summit Consulting Group, strategy room, Tuesday 8 AM
premise: The entire Q3 strategy brainstorm was erased from the main whiteboard overnight. The room has no cameras, but badge access is logged after 6 PM.

suspects.name: Derek Fong
suspects.motive: His idea was publicly shot down during the brainstorm session
suspects.alibi: I left at 5:30 PM and went straight home. I was on a video call with my brother from 7 PM to 9 PM. I never came back to the office.

suspects.name: Marissa Cole
suspects.motive: Wanted to redo the strategy after the client changed scope
suspects.alibi: I stayed until 7 PM finishing a client deck at my desk on the second floor. Then I walked to the parking garage and drove home.

suspects.name: Raj Patel
suspects.motive: Overheard saying the whiteboard was 'an eyesore that needed cleaning'
suspects.alibi: I left at 5 PM sharp like always. I had dinner reservations at Gio's at 6:30 across town. My wife and I were there until 8 PM.

suspects.name: Tanya Brooks
suspects.motive: Disagreed with the strategy direction and wanted a full reset
suspects.alibi: I was in the building until 8 PM for a board call in my corner office. After the call I went directly to the elevator and left.

clues.title: Security Guard's Log
clues.content: The overnight security guard confirms only two badge swipes into the building after 6 PM: one at 6:45 PM and one at 7:52 PM.

clues.title: Whiteboard Cleaner Residue
clues.content: The board was wiped with the industrial cleaning spray kept in the strategy room's supply cabinet. The spray bottle has fresh fingerprints on it.

clues.title: Badge Access Detail
clues.content: The 7:52 PM badge swipe was Tanya's card. But her corner office is on the fifth floor, and the badge log shows her card also accessed the third-floor strategy room at 8:10 PM.
